overview.about-body: This project was an exploration of information architecture. My goal was to assemble a dataset, look for trends or interesting insights and then visualize it in an understandable and engaging way

intro.sub-title: As a rock climber I thought it would be interesting to visualize all of my climbing adventures

collecting.body: I compiled my dataset by looking through climbing guides and noting attributes such as the location, height and difficulty of every climb I had completed.

exploring.body: I realized the most interesting aspect of my data was not the routes themselves but the locations I had traveled to do them. I decided to explore a visualization that indicated how far I traveled to each climbing area and the number of climbs I did there.

sketching.body: Using what I learned from the research I started an interative process of sketching starting with user flows and moving into higher fidelity wireframes. During this process I held work/critique sessions with the Opower UX team.

prototyping.body: From my wireframes I created high fidelity prototypes with limited interactivity. Since clear communication was essential to the success of this design, I wanted to test with proper visual hierarchy
